The claim was fact: checked by PolitiFact after readers asked if it was true that red trees represent the blood of Jesus and the resurrection in eastern European tradition.
Religious and history scholars: as well as a representative for the Orthodox Church in America, were consulted to verify the claim.
Father John Matusiak: web editor for the Orthodox Church in America, stated that there is no custom among Orthodox Christians, Roman Catholics, or Protestants to dye Christmas trees red to signify the blood of Christ and the Resurrection.
Nadieszda Kizenko: a history professor, and several other scholars confirmed that they have never heard of red trees being significant to the early Christian church, suggesting that the claim likely confuses the tradition of dyeing eggs red with western Christmas traditions.
